body.name: LG 65-Inch Class UR9000 Series Alexa Built-in 4K Smart TV (3840 x 2160),Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, USB, Ethernet, HDMI 60Hz Refresh Rate, AI-Powered 4K
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 16 hrs 47 mins
features: Home Cinema Experience: Enjoy movies and TV shows upscaled to 4K for a sharper image and more lifelike details.* See it as the director intended with FILMMAKER MODE. HDR10 Pro allows you to enjoy the latest HDR content with extended contrast for visuals that pop off the screen..Voltage : 120 volts (AC)

a5 AI Processor Gen6: Powered by AI, you will experience enhanced picture detail and improved sound from the a5 AI Processor Gen6 that upscales content to 4K* and detects room lighting to adjust color and picture contrast to optimal settings.

webOS 23 & LG Channels: Less searching, more streaming, thanks to the next generation of AI technology. Enjoy your favorite content including fitness, sports, entertainment and more. With Quick Cards, group your favorite apps into categories and use the Magic Remote to easily find what you're looking for. Get instant access to over 300 free channels with LG Channels.*
Super Slim Design: Focus on the screen with a slim and simple-to-mount design for a stylish view no matter where you hang it.
Powerful Gameplay: Quickly customize your gaming experience in one location with the LG Game Optimizer. And, with GeForce NOW included, you can automatically stream and get in the game.*
body.description: The LG 4K UHD TV that has the smarts to search, stream and recommend, with the extra content, like 300+ free LG Channels* that only LG can deliver. Plus, you can bring the cinema home with FILMMAKER MODE to see movies just the way directors intended. HDR10 Pro allows you to enjoy the latest HDR content with extended contrast for visuals that pop off the screen. Powered by AI, you will experience enhanced picture detail and improved sound from the a5 AI Processor Gen6 that upscales content to 4K** and detects room lighting to adjust color and picture contrast to optimal settings. You'll experience less searching and more streaming, thanks to the next generation of AI technology from LG webOS 23. With Quick Cards, group your favorite apps into categories and use the Magic Remote to easily find what you're looking for. Focus on the screen with a slim and simple-to-mount design for a stylish view no matter where you hang it. For gamers, you can quickly customize your gaming experience in one location with the LG Game Optimizer. And, with GeForce NOW included, you can automatically stream and get in the game.*** *Internet connection and subscriptions to streaming services are required; number of LG Channels subject to change. **Image quality of upscaled content will vary based on the source resolution. ***Subscription and compatible gaming controller are required.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Smart TV, simplified Do less searching and more streaming, thanks to the next generation of ThinQ AI and webOS. Stream your favorite shows, including fitness, sports, entertainment and more. Plus, get instant access to over 300 free channels with LG Channels.

Immerse yourself with a 4K UHD processor Experience enhanced picture detail and improved sound from the α5 AI Processor Gen6 that detects room lighting to adjust color and picture contrast to optimal settings. See every detail with impressive 4K upscaling Transform your regular content into 4K for sharper definition and detail, even on our biggest screens.
Make every night movie night Get your popcorn ready with a 4K viewing experience that’ll make it feel like you’re at the theater.
Up your game Make it the best gaming experience with Game Dashboard by quickly adjusting all your game settings in one location.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great picture and sound.
reviews.reviewText: So everyone complains about sound on a led flat screen. Let’s be honest if you get any flat screen tv for the sound you’re not too smart of a consumer. They are meant for picture. Sound here is actually decent. But let’s be real. Get a sound bar set up. I got the Vizio 5.1 surround sound unit with wireless subwoofer and it works perfectly with this tv.Picture quality is great here. For the price point, this 4KUHD is a great option. Glad I purchased it. The interface is fine but I use the fire stick so I’ll stick with that. No issues with refresh rate in sports, wrestling, movies or games. Now a SONY 4k tv was what I wanted, but at the same size Sony wanted 300-$400 more and I just didn’t see the need to spend that. Especially when this one was a 4K tv at a price that made more sense. I purchased the 50 inch

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great picture for the price...
reviews.reviewText: Easy setup and installation. Good color and picture for the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I am very partial to LG televisions. I just never have issues when I buy them and this TV is no exception. I bought this for my bedroom. The picture is great and the TV looks very nice. Setup was easy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Picture good, sound bad.
reviews.reviewText: I have 5 other LG tv's of various size and age. They all have a great picture as well as good sound. I even have a 65" like the one I just purchased, but several years old.Picture quality is fine, but the sound is not good at all. Sounds tinny and hollow, unlike all of my other LG's that sound great even without a sound bar.I broke down and purchased a LG 3.1 soundbar which makes it better but still not what it should be or as good as the older ones I have.Overall, I like the TV and the picture is fine, remote is a little marginal, but the sound is poor in comparison.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent TV for an Office
reviews.reviewText: I bought this TV for my wife's home office. She uses the set in a moderately bright room, and the television image is never washed out because of ambient light The picture is bright and clear, and the operating system functions smoothly. I have an LG QNED 90 in my living room, and this set comes very close to that set's mini-LED picture quality. The TV upscales SD content very well. I recommend this set over some of the less expensive offerings from other brands.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great as a "dumb" tv
reviews.reviewText: I have my own smart devices I use externally (like a windows pc for media stuff, roku, etc). I'm not using any of the built in "smart" features.When I first got it I looked around the menus and yeah, they are slow/sluggish (os issue?). But using it as a "dumb" tv (with wifi disabled), works great. Powers on very fast, powers off just as fast. Looks beautiful.The little built in speakers sound about how you'd expect, so get a sound bar with it if you want fuller/louder sound.Overall very happy with this, and the price is very fair.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Wait for the price to drop!
reviews.reviewText: I've barely gotten it out of the box and it is now listed here for $30 less than I paid for it. I overpaid - you shouldn't!The TV itself feels about average for this size. The picture is good, but not insanely great. The remote is unnecessarily complex - it has a point-to-move-the-cursor feature that works for some things and not others, even within LG's operating system functions, but the only "OK" button is also the wheel that activates the cursor. The OTA tuner picks up 10% fewer channels than the cheap Insignia it is replacing. The audio is tinny so I'll have to find a way to wedge in some kind of sound bar.The box and the TV itself all have "New for 2023" language on them but I really can't find a practical difference between this and the older model.Overall, meh, but I overpaid for meh!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very thoughtful boxing
reviews.reviewText: Great TV, easy for one person to put the legs on thanks to thoughtful packaging.
